202304，steam，steam掉卡抵扣，t a o宝，支付宝红包，hxxxx，indie gala，daily indie game，fanatical，杉果，它处自定义包入的本体约4元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198057093633', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1685672090}
review:
[h1]KART KAZANMA OYUNU[/h1]
Bu oyun tam bir kart kasma oyunudur!

Ülkemiz şartlarında oyuna artık para yatırmak lüks sayılıyor.

Bu yüzden oyuncular sanal ticaretlere atıldı. Bunlardan birisi de steam üzerinde kart kasarak paranızı katlamak, ve ben incelemelerimde tamda buna göre olan oyunları bulunduruyorum eğer paranızı iki veya üç katına çıkartıp oyun sayınızın artmasını istiyorsanız profilimi ve diğer incelemelerimi takip edebilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561199179679565', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1659520186}
review:
Tisnart Tiles виведе вас за рамки звичайних ігор «три в ряд»!... 120 рівнів цікавих поворотів і сюрпризів на цьому шляху. 
У якому напрямку гравітація тягне плитки вгору/вниз/ліворуч/праворуч? Жодна дошка не є однаковою. 
Унікальні бонуси, такі як Tile Blasters, Gravity Tiles, Tile flips, Gas Pods, що далі? Спостерігайте за Mr.Skull, 
він чекає, поки ви зробите помилку, щоб він міг вкрасти ваші плитки. Між розділеними дошками, плитками, 
що обертаються, і землетрусами у вас неодмінно запаморочиться голова. Думаєте, ви отримали те, що потрібно?

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1693366634}
review:
Es un juego similar al pet saga de King, tenes que romper bloques que se juntan de colores similares y asi juntar la X cantidad que te piden antes de que suba todo hacia arriba y pierdas (similar al tetris en este caso).

para pasar un rato y divertirte esta bien, la mecanica es esa, no innova en nada (y es peor esteticamente y mucho mas aburrido que el pet, aunque mas simplificado y eso tambien esta bien en cierta manera).

Tiene cromos y es barato, si te gusta entrenar la mente y las habilidades de coordinacion, es tu juego.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1499, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1688710851}
review:
Tisnart Tiles, sıradan eşleştirme 3 oyunlarının ötesine geçiyor!... Yolda 120 seviye eğlenceli sürpriz ve dönemeçler sizi bekliyor. Yönü çeken yer çekimi hangi yönde? Her biri farklı olan tahta. Tile Blasters, Gravity Tiles, Tile flips, Gas Pods gibi benzersiz güçlendiricilerle karşılaşacaksınız. Peki ya sonra ne gelecek? Bay Skull'a dikkat edin, hata yapmanızı bekliyor ve taşlarınızı çalacak. Bölünmüş tahtalar, dönen taşlar ve depremler arasında başınız dönecek. Yeterince yetenekli olduğunuzu düşünüyor musunuz?
Özellikler Listesi
Eğlenceli sürprizlerle dolu 120 seviye
Flip Tile, Bomb Tile, Gravity Tile gibi heyecan verici 9 Güçlendirici
Özel öğeleri kullanmak için madeni paralar toplayın: Multi Bomb veya Multi Blaster gibi
Tahtadaki taşları döndürmek için Rotator'ı kullanın
Tahtayı temizlemeye yardımcı olmak için Element taşlarını toplayın
İpuçları
Oyunda öğreticiler olsa da, oyuncunun keşfetmesi gereken birçok "şey" bulunmaktadır!
Başlık ekranı etkileşimli bir ekrandır.... yapabileceğiniz tüm farklı şeyleri çözebilir misiniz?
Ekstra madeni paralar için seviye seçim ekranında bazı sırlar olabilir... onları bulabilir misiniz?

review:
Tisnart Tiles is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam.  Click three blocks of the same colour to remove them, like a kind of inverse tetris/match-3 hybrid. 

You can play these games free on mobile, there's no way I could recommend anyone pays money for one just so they can pretend their gaming rig is an iPhone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1514938123}
review:
https://youtu.be/66zHivnmbCs

A lot of the basic mechanics are pushed to the limit in this color matching game twisting the direction and space of play.  The core however remains the same where rapid random clicking is almost as effective as patient considered play leaving the experience feeling unsatisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095787408', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1553549810}
review:
Da sempre gli scienzati si pongono una domanda a cui nessuno fino ad ora era stato in grado di rispondere:  "Come si potrebbe rendere Tetris un gioco da trip di lsd con annesse crisi di epilessia". Ora come ora l'evoluzione dell'uomo non ha permesso il raggiungimento ad una risposta a questo amletico dubbio, ma è qui che è entrato in gioco Tisnart Tiles. Dall'idea di un sopravissuto di Cernobyll nasce il figlio dell'unione di Tetris (velocità 10) e Puzzle Bubble (god mod). Tisnart Tiles con la sua fantastica gamma di colori a 0,5 bit (che comprende gli spettacolari colori primari più il nero), con i suoi server a 120 tick (attualmente proibiti da casa Valve) e la frenesia di UT e QUAKE  messi insieme si rivela il cocktail perfetto per ogni amante del pro gaming e della sfida videoludica per eccellenza (fanculo Dark Souls). Non basteranno 10 diversi mouse da gaming per tenere il ritmo di questo mirabolante esperimento scientifico mancato, potrete dire addio alla vostra vita sociale e alla vostra droga preferita (crack, eroina o memes) da oggi sarete i sultani di un unico grande dio: Tisnart Tiles.

We're the sultans of Tisnart...
-Mark Knopfler

EDIT: l'aggiunta del colore verde con l'aumentare dei livelli ha reso la mia esperienza ancora più immersiva (abbiamo raggiunto gli 0,7 bit) solo che ora la mia 1080 ti overcloccata fatica a tenere i 60 fps con settaggi a ultra.

EDIT 2: appena upgradato a una rtx 2080 ti overcloccata 60 fps rock solid :)))

author: {'steamid': '76561198040076212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1500444271}
review:
«Tisnart Tiles» - типичный представитель головоломок «три в ряд», где мы сбиваем блоки одного цвета до тех пор, пока не наберём нужное количество очков, не позволяя конструкции разрастись за пределы игрового поля. 120 уровней, где по мере прохождения открываются усилители, создаются разнообразные уникальные условия, появляются новые функциональные блоки. Некой «глобальной» цели здесь нет. Нужно всего лишь одолевать этапы игры, пока не доберётесь до конца.

Подобный тип головоломок широко распространён в мобильных приложениях и браузерных бесплатных играх. Смысл тот же: чем дальше проходишь, тем комплекснее и сложнее становится. Различных модификаторов куча. К примеру, часто вам потребуется точность в нахождении блоков, которые можно разбить. А если кликнуть «не туда», блок пометится «мёртвым», и его практически никак невозможно убрать. Также есть возможность менять гравитацию поля, замедлять падение блоков в определённой части зоны, взрывать все квадраты одного цвета или окрашивать в один цвет несколько штук в конкретной зоне и так далее. Таких функциональных блоков много, и их разнообразие с каждым уровнем только увеличивается.

Кроме того, само окружение способно создавать сложности. Место, откуда выпадают блоки, может располагаться со всех четырёх сторон экрана. Сама игровая зона частенько делится на две-три-четыре части, и в каждой необходимо следить, чтобы длина конструкции не вышла за пределы своего поля. Вас могу осыпать блоками сверху и снизу одновременно, скорость их появления также меняется, и на поздних этапах спустя время сам уровень способен переворачивать часть игровой зоны, вводя вас в заблуждение и чаще раздражение. Заблокированные блоки, блоки, которые нужно убрать за отведённое число ходов, блоки-стихии и тому подобное – всё это влияет на то, как каждый последующий уровень играется немного иначе и заставляет не впасть в полную тоску.

Оканчивая уровни, вы собираете монетки, которые потом можно тратить на платные усилители. Какой-то превращает все блоки одного цвета в другие, какой-то выбивает целые колонны, но самый полезный на последних этапах – бомба, сбивающая все блоки в определённой зоне покрытия, включая «мёртвые». Благо, к тому времени у вас накопится такое количество монет, что гриндить их не придётся, чтобы активно пользоваться данными способностями. 

О технической стороне мало что можно рассказать. Настройки позволяют лишь включить или выключить музыку и звуки и сделать игру на полный экран. Больше ничего. Даже сделать громче или тише и поменять разрешение не позволяют. В остальном, игра работает нормально и даже в оконном режиме не раздражает. Собственно, больше ничего о «Tisnart Tiles» не скажешь. Это добротный представитель касты чистых головоломок без примесей, разнообразный, затягивающий и, откровенно говоря, не такой уж и сложный, если у вас быстрые пальцы и намётанный глаз.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1495685365}
review:
Tags: Clicker - Fast
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

Troubleshooting Note:
I had to disable steam overlay for this to even launch.

TLDR: Tabletported click-to-remove match3 variant. Quota attack campaign. Quality of port felt dubious.

Once launched all you get is a Play button. No options of any kind and the game will not fullscreen at all. If you decide to soldier on in the window you will find the game loads a tetris style empty pane with blocks of 4 different colors in them. Then one by one starts filling the bottom row with new blocks. Your mission, if you accept it, is to click on a block so that all adjacent blocks of the same color are removed from the board, with the goal of eliminating a certain quota of blocks defined as a winning end goal by the level.

Conclusion : Between the lazy port to PC, the mechanic thats been played out before, and done better in other casual games, the market saturation, the rather limited sound assets, and the rather plain and uninteresting visual presentation I would advise to stay well away. This is flash game territory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060446059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1466739334}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028216179', 'num_games_owned': 2423, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1488163702}
review:
[i]Tisnart Tiles[/i] is a simple match three puzzle game that consists of 120 levels of gameplay. There is no story, no hidden content, nothing complicated; what you see is what you get. Unfortunately this also means if you’ve played one level then you’ve played them all. The game suffers from being repetitive and despite giving players special powers to use during levels and items to buy with gold you gain, sitting and playing more than five levels may become boring. The difficulty increases as you progress but it doesn’t take long to master the challenges the game throws at you, leaving players waiting for something new.

That being said, the gameplay is very simple and fun. Your goal is to match three or more tiles of the same color to take them off of the board. Each level gives you a goal of how many tiles of certain colors to collect, you are also timed with a bar that pushes the tiles up to the top or bottom of the screen, once it hits the edge it’s game over. The game adds in new twists to try and change things up, such as gravity playing a factor in where tiles end up. Some levels can seem very topsy turvy with things moving side-to-side even. There are also power up titles that pop up on the board, these can flip tiles over or change titles to certain colors along with a host of other things. I personally found only a handful of them useful and the game didn’t offer new power tiles as often as I’d like. You also gain gold in the game which can be used to buy items which can be the most useful things in the game though fifty levels in and I found myself with a surplus of gold taking away any sort of strategy on when to buy an item.

This is a good title to grab on sale, or even at its current normal price but it’s short and simple. The same music plays throughout the game and the graphics are very basic. While there are certainly better match three games to be found, [i]Tisnart Tiles[/i] isn’t a bad addition to your library.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]Affordable game with Steam trading cards.
    [*]Simple gameplay to learn, easy to pick up for short bursts of fun.
    [*]It is fun and some levels can be challenging. 
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
    [*]Gets repetitive very easily.
    [*]Not color blind friendly, graphics in general are bland.
    [*]The same music plays over and over again.
[*]No Steam achievements.
[/list]

Make sure to visit [url=cassus.org]cassus.org[/url] for more quality reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 1588, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1488035682}

puzzles strats too easy then get real hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991369092', 'num_games_owned': 2901, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1475127982}
review:
A simple match-3 type puzzle game.  Very mutch a single-player version of many of the popular "puzzle fighter" games (the puzzle fighter one, Puyo Pop, etc.) but with a bit more streamline mechanics (you're selecting which groups of blocks to "pop" with your mouse instead of shifting the puzzle pieces to form combos.)  

Not a bad game, but even so I don't think $6 is the right price for this game.  Maybe pick it up in a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098137812', 'num_games_owned': 2285, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1474251010}
review:
[h1] Boring match 3 game[/h1]

It has some interesting effects, like the changes in gravity and the power up items but... It's just too simply, repetitive and boring. There're some other match 3 games outthere, cheaper, even older but better. [spoiler] who said The Treasures of Montezuma or 10,000,000? It wasn't me. *cof* [/spoiler] 
 

If you got it for free, just want some cards or kill some time it's okay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087834803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1456561123}
review: Fun match 3 game with good variety in level design. Unfortunately the difficulty curve kind of breaks down at the later levels; they're so fast you don't really have time to strategize, but by that point in the game, you basically have an infinite supply of coins and can keep dropping bomb powerups whenever the tiles get too high, so it feels oddly too hard and too easy at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113665017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1449220996}
review: Tisnart Tiles is a colorful match-3 puzzle game which features a number of interesting innovations to the genre. The difficulty grows gradually so you won't have a feeling of the game being overwrought (but you can get this feeling if you decide to play more complex levels after a while since you have played previous ones). And yeah, sometimes this game will really have you on the edge, as they have promised. So, it could be of interest to you if you're into match-3 games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020988146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1441277705}
review: A bit complicated in the beginning but after a while you get hooked to this fine little game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981552352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1442862882}
review: Everyone is entitled to their opinion, but after reading the reviews on this great game, I decided to give it a shot because I like match 3 games. I would like to say that Tisnart Tiles is IMO the best match 3 game I've played..!  Not only does it keep you on your toes, but is very fun to play. After the easy levels (not many) the game gets intense and game play is amazing with it's twist and turns. Gravity is just over the top and screen rotation is very cool among other great features.  Bonuses and power-ups are awesome and the sounds in the game fit it perfect. If you like match 3 games, Tisnart Tiles is perfect to add to your collection. I would highly recommend you download and play it. Everything about the game is amazing. Watch out for Mr. Skull. Also you'll find some hidden secrets. Not giving it away and you'll have to figure it out for yourself. The author went over and above in this well thought out match 3. Tisnart Tiles is an amazing game. 5 stars from me and 2 thumbs up..!! Excellent job....

author: {'steamid': '76561197967628117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1489044246}
review:
This is the kind of game I loved as a kid. Downloading a game off the BBS by some lone developer. Sure it's not the most graphically intense, but there's a certain charm behind indie developers. 

Yes, it's a match 3 game. Yet, this is NOT one of those overly polished games like "Candy Crush" made by a giant corporation . Those insidious games designed to tear your money away from you. I'd rather pay for a game up-front rather than play a freemium game designed to torture me until I give them all my money. 

Here, you get well designed gameplay. There's a nice gradual ramp up in difficulty. Gameplay features are added before it gets too stale. When you start to get close to the edge of losing, it becomes rather exciting as you rush to clear any tiles.

Looking at the negative reviews:
"It's not color-blind friendly!"  Look, indie developers can be just one guy/girl. Chances are there was just never any thought of color-blind people. I'm sure the developer isn't color blind so they might not know how to fix this. Make a suggestion in the forums. I mean come on, you're a color-blind person playing a match-3 style game based on colors. Doesn't make much sense.

"The sound is awful": No, it's not. Though, I'd prefer less generic music. But, hey! The great thing about these types of games, is I can mute them and play my own music. 

Also: It's easy to rip on people's games. Indie devs don't have giant teams. You can dislike a game and not be a dick about it. These games are still developed by real people. You may think you're funny, but you're not.

Overall: A fun game. Good game design. That's hard to do in with all the Match-3 games. Suprisingly it starts to get a little challenging at later levels. Ok graphics and sound.  It doesn't wear out its welcome by providing a lot of new and interesting gameplay elements.  This is the perfect type of game to kill a few minutes at a time, and have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113473980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1441212096}
review: If you enjoy match 3 games then this is up your alley.  The gameplay is comfortable and easy to grasp from the beginning and takes a bit before it gets challenging, but once it does it offers a good variety of gameplay and level types.  I would like to see the visuals cleaned up a bit, but overall its a solid experience that I recommend, especially for people looking for some quick, casual gaemplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115624242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1442046002}
review:
Not colour-blind friendly.

This game initially seems like quite an interesting variation on the classic Japanese [i]Chain Shot!/SameGame[/i] formula.  It adds new features to the game and, if you like the genre, may be worth playing.

However, when I reached the eighth level, they introduced green tiles and for me - a person with red/green colour-blindness - it then becomes a 'guess if the tile is green or red' game.  This is not unique to this game - puzzle games for decades (and other genres) have failed to provide an option for those who cannot easily distinguish between two certain colours.  It would be very simple to add such an option, yet many game designers neglect to think of those with colour-blindness (around 8% of men; a smaller percentage of women).

If you have 'normal' colour vision and like puzzle games, you may enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014241094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1506288120}
review:
Tisnart Tiles is the digital gaming equivalant of a "diamond in the rough". Meaning that even though parts of the game a rough around the edges, it oozes with indie love. This one man team created a very deep puzzler with a ton of varying gameplay rules resulting in some interesting twists. From multiple line creations, changes in gravity, tons of powerup items or the infamous Skull tile these and more create a ton of puzzle styles.

If you enjoy puzzlers, take a close look at this one, its worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085995031', 'num_games_owned': 7977, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1442342370}
review:
hello everybody its me woodlandfaerietruck! the bundle stork brought me another game today. this one is called tisnart tiles.  thats a pretty bad name, but i was excited anyway because i usually like this kind of thing. it probably is fun. the pictures of the game on steam make it look like a good time, but i had a couple of big problems with it.

you see, dear friends, baby jesus blessed me with sensitive ears, so it truly pains me when the game makes the most obnoxious noise you could imagine everytime i make a match that counts towards one of the goals for the level.  holy dogshit on a stick sitting on the sidewalk on a hot summers day, i don't know how anyone could think that putting in such an annoying sound that happens so frequently is a good idea.  after a few minutes of listening to it, my cat vomitted, one of my guinea pigs died, and my girlfriend promised i could watch one whole episode of star trek if i turned the volume down. it was that bad!

the other thing that pisses me off is that i have to play through a whole bunch of pathetically easy levels to get to the ones that might be fun. i got up to level 10, and i am still at the point where i can mindlessly click anywhere on the board to beat the level with no effort whatsoever.  it looks like i still have over a dozen more levels to go before i even get through the levels that are called 'easy peasy'. that sucks. there is no way to  skip ahead to the levels that are probably fun to play. i don't want to eat through a bowl of dogshit because someone put ice cream at the bottom.  jesus has blessed me with over 2700 steam games. evil sinner devs had better bring the fun or i am moving onto something else.

in closing, i am done with this one.  these evil sinner devs had a chance, but they blew it by testing my patience. give me an option to skip all the levels that wouldn't challenge a mentally crippled 5 year old, and i might be back. until then, i cannot recommend this game to humans who value their time. robots may enjoy the monotony of clicking randomly to win. animals will likely suffer permanent harm due to the terrible sound effects.  negative 15 stars out of ten.
